title: GitHub Actions summary of frequently used settings
body: ## Turn the test at any given time If you fire both push and pull requests in all cases, a test with the same content will fire twice on the pull request. Therefore, Actions are fired at the timing when the pull request is created, when the pull request is updated, or when it is merged (pushed to master). ```yml on: push: branches: - master pull_request: types: - opened - synchronize ``` ## Turn the process around at the specified time. Actions can be turned on by cron. The characters in `cron: ***` should be in any cron notation and must be in UTC. Do not use this function if you need exact time processing, since it is not executed at the exact time. When I tried to run the process with `0 0 * * * * `, it was executed at around 9:30 JST. Reference: [crontab guru](https://crontab.guru/) ```yml on: schedule: - cron: '0 0 * * *' ``` ## Cache any directory ```yml jobs: deploy: runs-on: ubuntu-latest strategy: matrix: node-version: ['16'] steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v2 - uses: actions/cache@v2 with: key: 'assets-2022-04-01' path: ./portal/src/assets/ ``` ## Store/use cache (npm) ```yml jobs: lint: runs-on: ubuntu-latest strategy: matrix: node-version: ['16'] steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v2 - uses: actions/setup-node@v2 with: node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }} cache: 'npm' cache-dependency-path: portal/package-lock.json ``` ## Store/use cache (pip) ```yml jobs: deploy: runs-on: ubuntu-latest steps: - uses: actions/checkout@v2 - uses: actions/setup-python@v3 with: python-version: '3.10' cache: 'pip' cache-dependency-path: 'requirements.lock.txt' ```
